reasoning: Reporting incidence at ~0.7 per 100k births (approximately 1 in 8,000-15,000 live births globally). Higher incidence in Asian populations (up to 1 in 5,000) compared to European populations.
source: Yoon PW et al. (1997). Biliary atresia in the United States, 1979-1989. J Pediatr. 131(4):536-40
